params.tokenFactoryAddress_: The address of the IATKTokenFactory contract.

ETHTransfersNotAllowed().notice: Error indicating that an attempt was made to send Ether to a contract that does not allow or expect it.

InvalidTokenFactoryAddress().notice: Error indicating that an invalid token factory address was provided.

TokenImplementationNotSet().notice: Error indicating that the token implementation address has not been set.

userdoc.notice: Provides common functionality for asset proxy contracts that interact with an IATKTokenFactory         to determine their implementation address and handle initialization.

devdoc.author: SettleMint Tokenization Services
devdoc.details: Child contracts must:      1. Call the constructor with the `IATKTokenFactory` address.      2. Implement `_getSpecificImplementationAddress` to fetch their logic contract address from the         `IATKTokenFactory` and revert with a specific error (e.g., `AssetImplementationNotSet`) if not found.      3. In their own constructor, fetch the implementation address, prepare initialization data,         and then call `_performInitializationDelegatecall`.

params.tokenFactoryAddress_: The address of the IATKTokenFactory contract.

ETHTransfersNotAllowed().details: Many contracts are not designed to receive or hold Ether directly, and will revert such transactions to prevent loss of funds or unexpected behavior.

devdoc.title: Abstract Base Proxy for ATK Assets
